job.title: Software Test Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Defense & Space,Computer Software
job.description:
Job Description
Metron's ORCA division in San Diego, CA is seeking software testers to contribute to the design and development of a family of large-scale defense and homeland security simulations. The successful candidate will be responsible for testing and evaluating ORCA’s applications and systems.
Responsibilities
Designing, executing, and debugging test plans of applications based on software requirements and technical specifications
Creating test cases and validating results against functional requirements
Detecting and identifying software failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected
Documenting results and generating historical analysis of applications’ state and stability
Documenting anomalies and defects in a maintained issue tracking database
Deploying, operating, and maintaining application test instances and/or networks
Ensuring compliance with general software development, testing, and maintenance best practices
Ensuring data integrity standards
Participating in application planning meetings
Evaluating software ease of usability and error handling procedures
Providing application instructions for users
Desired Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or other related field
Minimum 1 year of experience
Must possess excellent written and verbal skills to communication with development team
Must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment
Strong knowledge of quality assurance methodologies, test plans, and debugging is required
Previous test automation experience is a plus
US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED, position will require background investigation to authorize access to classified information
Position Location: Liberty Station, San Diego, CA
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. Metron takes affirmative action in support of its policy to employ and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.
